page.title: 10 Salt marsh ecology
page.content: The portions of Motney Hill saltings standing above the high water mark bear a rich plant cover. To an extent this is also true of the inter- tidal parts.All of the plants are typical of the marine coastal sere and are tolerant of salinity.They include Glasswort or Marsh Samphire (Salicornia),Sea Lavender (Limonium V.), Scurvy Grass (Cochlearia),Sea Purslane (Pendunculata ) and Arrow Grass (Triglochin).These plants are distributed in a very precise sequence relative to the inter-tidal channels. Sea Lavender and Arrow Grass on the highest driest parts,Sea Purslane and Scurvy Grass at the channel edges but still on the high parts and Glasswort within the channels in the inter-tidal zone though not in the channel floors which are covered with a fresh deposit of silt at each tide.
